item.title: Search Results
item.description: This file exists solely to respond to /search URL with the related search layout template. No content shown here is rendered, all content is based in the template layouts/page/search.html Setting a very low sitemap priority will tell search engines this is not important content. This implementation uses Fusejs, jquery and mark.js Initial setup Search depends on additional output content type of JSON in config.toml ``` [outputs] home = [“HTML”, “JSON”] ```

item.title: 멜X 벅X 지X 비교
item.description: 멜X 벅X 지X :셔플: : ○ : : △ : : Ｘ :

item.title: B Positive S01E12 영어 표현
item.description: 1. well-off 유복한, 부유한. - Samantha: A doctor. Do you have a-a practice in the city? - Doctor: No, I travel around the world helping children in need. - Samantha: Oh, that’s so wonderful. Do you work for one of those big, worldwide organizations? - Doctor: No, I’m on my own. One-man band. - Samantha: Oh. Well, you must be pretty well-off to be flying all over the world.

item.title: The Unicorn S02E12 영어 표현
item.description: 1. fast 단식하다, 절식하다; 금식하다. - Wade: Aren’t you supposed to fast when you have a colonoscopy? 2. account 이유. - Michelle: Look, I know you’re trying to be nice to Meg on my account, but you don’t have to be. 3. break off sth to end a relationship. - Wade: I mean, I know we did the right thing be breaking it off. 4. clean as a whistle extremely clean.

item.title: 210219 다만, 널 사랑하고 있어 [2006]
item.description: “좋아하는 사람이 좋아하는 사람을 좋아하고 싶었을 뿐이야”

item.title: 왜 나는 너를 사랑하는가 글귀
item.description: p. 39 가장 매력을 느끼지 못하는 사람을 가장 쉽게 유혹할 수 있다는 것은 사랑의 아이러니 가운데 하나이다. p. 41 유혹에 서툰 사람이 오히려 진정한 마음을 가진 사람이라고 관대하게 봐줄 수도 있다.

item.title: Modern Family S01E06 영어 표현
item.description: 1. have/know sth down pat to know something so well that you can say or do it without having to try or think. - Jay: I wasn’t the greatest husband the first time around, but, I’m tyring to do better this time. And maybe by my third marriage, I’ll have it down pat. 2. mean to ~ 할 셈이다. - Phil: What ya reading there? A book? - Claire: Yeah.

item.title: The Unicorn S02E08 영어 표현
item.description: 1. give off 풍기다. - Jared: Uh, this is a liability release form. I need you and your husband to sign it. - Shannon: What? Him? - Wade: Yo-You thought that we were together? - Shannon: That’s so funny. No, no, no, no, no. - Wade: No, we’re not together. I mean, we came here together, but we’re not married or anything. - Shannon: Do we give off that vibe?

item.title: B Positive S01E07 영어 표현
item.description: 1. table to delay discussion of a subject. - Gina: I can see your lips moving, but I can not hear you talking. - Drew: Uh… Why don’t we table this for later? 2. get under sb’s skin to annoy someone. - Gina: She said my crazy kidney guy left her a snarky-ass message about how great I am that really got under her skin. 3. be/get carried away to become so excited about something that you do not control what you say or do.

item.title: 210212 The Family Man [2000]
item.description: - Kate: If you need this, Jack, if you really need this, I will take these kids from a life they love, and I’ll take myself from the only home we’ve ever shared together, and I’ll move wherever you need to go. I’ll do that because I love you. I love you, and that’s more important to me than our address. I choose us. - Kate: I’m sure that right now, there’s nowhere else I’d rather be than here with you.

item.title: 210131 Vocabulary List
item.description: 1. prospect v. 조사하다 2. leave n. 휴가 3. check n. 저지 4. relic n. 유물, 유적 5. accomodate v. 수용하다 6. finance v. 자금을 공급하다 7. deposit v. 예금하다 8. soar v. 폭등하다, 날아오르다 9. soarer n. 나는 것 10. sanitation n. 위생 관리, 공중위생 11. shortcoming n. 불충분한 점, 결점 12. courier n. 택배 회사 13. adhere v.

item.title: The Unicorn S02E06 영어 표현
item.description: 1. flat out 딱 부러지게, 완전히. - Cynthia: And I love his family and his dogs, but I told him flat out, I won’t do that with Butch in the room. 2. ill at ease feeling anxious and not relaxed. - Wade: Yeah, uh, Forrest got a deal online, but they make him nervous. - Forrest: Nah, more ill at ease, let’s say. 3. get off on the right/wrong foot to make a successful/unsuccessful start in something.

item.title: 하얀 늑대들 XI 글귀
210127 Vocabulary List
item.description: 1. keen adj. 예리한 2. comprehensive adj. 포괄적인, 종합적인 3. by chance phr. 우연히, 뜻밖에 4. complimentary adj. 무료의; 칭찬하는 5. claim v. 얻다 6. pick something up phr. ~을 찾다[찾아오다] 7. venue n. 현장, 장소 8. intermittently adv. 때때로, 간헐적으로 9. marginal adj. (자격, 능력 등이) 최저의, 한계의 10. marginally adv. 아주 조금 11. marginalize v. 사회의 주류에서 몰아내다

item.title: 하얀 늑대들 X 글귀
B Positive S01E06 영어 표현
item.description: 1. grow a pair [Verb] (vulgar,idiomatic) To be brave; to show some courage, especially in a situation in which one has so far failed to do so. - Gideon: You’re a shrink. Can’t you get a copy of the eval and coach her through it? - Drew: Oh, no, no. I couldn’t. That would be cheating. - Samantha: Grow a pair, Bambi. 2. take the high road to behave in a moral way when other people are not behaving morally.

item.title: Modern Family S01E02 영어 표현
item.description: 1. put one’s foot down 단호한 태도를 취하다. - Phil: Sometimes a man’s gotta put his foot down and do what a man’s gotta do. 2. rub sb the wrong way to annoy someone without intending to. - Mitchell: Her future best friend might be in that class, and I don’t wanna rub anyone the wrong way. 3. start sb off {?1}. ~에게(~을 하기) 시작하게 하다. {?2}. ~가 (~을) 시작하도록 하다[돕다/이끌다].

item.title: Modern Family S01E01 영어 표현
item.description: 1. tell someone off to tell someone that they have done something wrong and that you are angry about it. 야단 치다. - Soccer Mom: Come on, Coach. You gotta take that kid out. - Gloria: You wanna take him out? How about I take you out? - Jay: Honey, honey. - Gloria: Why don’t you worry about your son? He spent the first half with his hand in his pants!

item.title: Modern Family S01E16 영어 표현
item.description: 1. get off to …으로 시작하다. - Cameron: We got off to an awkward start with our pediatrician, a very nice Asian lady named Dr. Miura. 2. queen a gay man. - Cameron: Why do you think the dentist gives me all that free stuff? - Mitchell: Um, because he’s a huge queen and he has a big crush on you. 3. by all means ? - Manny: I have a fever.

item.title: Modern Family S01E15 영어 표현
item.description: 1. trump (더 나응 말 또는 행동으로 상대를) 이기다[능가하다]. - Phil: Did he trump me? You tell me. He made a painting out of a photograph one time. I have hand-picked a card, drawn a heart in the steam on the medicine cabinet, and taken Claire to Fratelli’s, a family-style Italian restaurant, for 17 years in a row. Yeah, he got me. He got me. 2. settle {?1}. 합의를 보다.

item.title: Modern Family S01E14 영어 표현
item.description: 1. not have a clue to have no knowledge about something, or to be unable to remember something. - Haley: I need to date someone who has a clue, instead of an idioit who bangs his head every time he rides his bike out of his garage- every time! 2. clutch cool. - Phil: That movie’s so clutch. 3. splash 대성공. - Claire: I don’t mind saying I was making quite a splash.

item.title: Modern Family S01E13 영어 표현
item.description: 1. come out of the closet Admitting to being gay. - Mitchell: I came out of the closet in my mid-20s. 2. as they come Very. - Jay: These guys don’t understand the gay thing. Why create an awkward situation? That’s all I’m saying. - Mitchell: That’s weird, because your friend Shorty there- gay as they come. 3. put out To be willing to engage in casual sexual activity; be sexually available.

item.title: Modern Family S01E12 영어 표현
item.description: 1. old ball and chain one’s wife. - Jay: So, trouble in gay paradise, huh? - Mitchell: He just can’t say no to anybody who needs help. And why do you have to always add the word “gay” where it doesn’t belong? - Jay: Hey, hey, you’re not mad at me. You’re mad at the old balls and chain.

item.title: Modern Family S01E11 영어 표현
item.description: 1. out of the blue 갑자기, 난데없이. - Jay: The hell is he doing here? - Gloria: Jay. - Jay: No. He was supposed to pick up Manny yesterday and disappointed him again, as usual. Now he just sails in here out of the blue? 2. by all means 물론, 분명히. - Phil: By all means, Claire, we want you looking your sexiest when the hunky, gay firemen get here!

item.title: Modern Family S01E10 영어 표현
item.description: 1. stage (면밀한 계획이 필요한 일을, 특히 대중 시위로) 벌이다. - Cameron: Uh, last year, one of my carolers-Andrew- staged a little coup. 2. canned 해고당한. - Cameron: Thanks, Santa. - Santa: Can’t call me that anymore. Just got canned. 3. sharp (하루 중의 특정 시간을 나타내는 표현 뒤에 쓰여) 정각. - Jay: Okay. Tonight, 9:00 sharp, we open one present each. 4. swing [속어] 부부 교환[그룹 섹스]을 하다; 프리섹스를 하다.

item.title: Modern Family S01E09 영어 표현
item.description: 1. bag to hunt and kill an animal or bird. - Gloria: We can’t give Luke a crossbow. He pokes himself in the eye every time he uses a straw. - Jay: Are you kidding? I had one when I was his age. My dad used to give me a quarter for every crow I bagged. 2. throw 비격식 [VN] 충격을 주다, 당혹스럽게[놀라게] 하다. - Manny: I need your advice, Jay.

item.title: Modern Family S01E08 영어 표현
item.description: 1. bureau 서랍장. - Claire: Okay, your turn. - Phill: My turn? Where is it? - Claire: It’s on the bureau. 2. raise the roof to play/sing very loudly and enthusiastically. - Cameron: Ooh, raise the roof, Lily. 3. kick off (~을) 시작하다. - Claire: Wait a minute. You- You thought the coupons were your only present? Are you kidding me? - Phil: They aren’t? - Claire: No! Oh, Phil, come on.

item.title: Modern Family S01E07 영어 표현
item.description: 1. drop the ball (책임지고 있는 일을) 실수로 망치다. - Phil: And then, uh, I guess that leaves Luke. We dropped the ball a little on that one. - Claire: Yeah, a little bit. 2. panties on a bunch When someone acts in an anal-retentive manner, and makes a big fuss out of a relatively minor problem. - Mitchell: That took a while. - Cameron: She’s been asleep for 20 minutes.

item.title: Modern Family S01E05 영어 표현
item.description: 1. sweep sth under the rug to hide a problem or try to keep it secret instead of dealing with it. - Gloria: She’s always had a problem with me. I think I’m gonna find out what it is. - Jay: That’s the worst thing you could do. Just sweep it under the rug. 2. in light of sth …에 비추어, …을 고려하여. - Phil: Now in light of what happened at school today, do you have any feelings you’d like to express?

item.title: Modern Family S01E04 영어 표현
item.description: 1. pull a fast one To deceive someone. - Jay: Listen, I would love to get this thing behind us, but Gloria would never forgive me if I pulled a fast one on her. That’s why you’re goning to pull a fast one on her, and I’m not going to like it one bit. 2. spring 갑자기 알리다[발언하다](announce, reveal). - Jay: So you just spring it on Gloria like this?

item.title: Hugo autolink 방지
item.description: 1. 문제 Hugo 0.60부터 기본 Markdown library는 Goldmark입니다.1 이 Goldmark는 CommonMark를 준수하며 주소에 자동으로 링크를 거는 것 같습니다.1 그래서 아래 표의 왼쪽처럼 그냥 주소를 입력하면 오른쪽처럼 자동으로 링크가 됩니다. 입력 출력 https://2ynhub.github.io/hugo-blog/ https://2ynhub.github.io/hugo-blog/ 2. 해결2 아래처럼 :// 세 글자 중 아무 곳 앞에 \를3 쓰면 됩니다. https\://2ynhub.github.io/hugo-blog/ https:\//2ynhub.github.io/hugo-blog/ https:/\/2ynhub.github.io/hugo-blog/ 3. References https://gohugo.io/getting-started/configuration-markup/#goldmark ↩︎ https://gist.github.com/alexpeattie/4729247 ↩︎

item.title: How I Met Your Mother S09E24 영어 표현
item.description: 1. rsvp (초대장에서) 회답 주시기 바랍니다(프랑스어 répondez s’il vous plaît(please reply)를 줄인 것). - Ted: You rsvp’d no.

item.title: How I Met Your Mother S09E23 영어 표현
item.description: 1. too rich for one’s blood Too expensive or fancy to suit one’s taste or preferences. - Lily: So the only way you’re allowed to hook up with her is if you marry her. - Barney: Too rich for my blood. 2. great Scott An interjection of surprise, amazement, or dismay. - Barney: You still dating that guy? (놀라는 표정) Great scotch!

item.title: How I Met Your Mother S09E21 영어 표현
item.description: 1. sweep the leg To show no mercy or compassion, kicking someone while they’re down. The Karate Kid (1984)에 나온 대사. - Zabka: If I was gonna do anything, I’d sweep the leg, and put you in a body bag. 2. pickle 곤란한[불쾌한] 입장, 곤경. -Robin: Because sometimes I just feel like he never listens to me, you know? -Patrice: Gosh, caller, that’s a real pickle. 3. storm off To leave a place or a person suddenly because you are very angry.

item.title: How I Met Your Mother S09E20 영어 표현
item.description: 1. cold turkey <흡연이나 마약 등을> 즉각 끊다. - Ted: From the moment Marshall left for Minnesota, Lily’s been secretly puffing down the ciggies like a 46-year-old grandma at a reno slot machine. Problem was, come Friday morning, she knew she’d have to quit again, cold turkey.

item.title: How I Met Your Mother S09E19 영어 표현
item.description: 1. spin yarn 이야기를 장황하게 늘어놓다. - Ted: I’ve told you this one before. - Tracy: A few times. - Ted: I’m just a boring old man who won’t stop spinning yarns.

item.title: How I Met Your Mother S09E08 영어 표현
item.description: 1. bury the hatchet 화해하다. - Barney: All Robin wants to do is put this whole thing behind her. - Loretta: Fine. If Robin’s ready to bury the hatchet, then I guess I’m ready to bury the hatchet. 2. pull your head out of your ass Stop ignoring the problems around you. - Lily: God, do you really think that you’re gonna find some perferct girl who checks off every item on your list?

item.title: How I Met Your Mother S09E06 영어 표현
item.description: 1. come around (미) [다른 의견·입장으로] 바꾸다, 동조하다, [싫었던 사람이] 좋아지다[to ‥]; 토론 등을 결말짓다, 화해하다. - Barney: He’s a mean old tool. - Lily: Oh, he can’t be that bad. I’ll get him to come around. 2. coming out the wazoo Having in a plentiful amount. - Lily: What did you do wrong? - Robin: We really wanted him to marry us. His church has cute coming out the wazoo.

item.title: Hugo 블로그 테마의 메뉴 주소와 순서 바꾸기
item.description: 1. 환경 Linux hugo theme: LoveIt address: https://2ynhub.github.io/hugo-blog/ 2. 문제 Hugo 블로그 우상단의 메뉴인 Categories, Posts, Tags 링크가 https://2ynhub.github.io/hugo-blog/categories/로 안 나오고 https://2ynhub.github.io/hugo-blog/hugo-blog/categories/처럼 hugo-blog 부분이 2번 나오는 문제가 있었습니다. 그리고 메뉴의 순서가 Posts, Tags, Categories인데 바꿔보겠습니다. 3. 해결1 3-1. 메뉴 주소 변경 Open config.toml Search [[menu.main]] 각 identifier의 url에서 앞의 /를 제거 3-2. 메뉴 순서 변경 Open config.toml Search [[menu.main]] weight가 1부터 왼쪽에 표시됩니다. 순서에 맞게 변경 4.

item.title: Hugo + GitHub Pages로 블로그 만들기
item.description: 1. 환경 Linux hugo git GitHub 2. 개요 Hugo로 블로그를 만들고 GitHub Pages에 hosting 해보겠습니다. 블로그의 주소는 https://<깃헙 아이디>.github.io/<블로그>/로 만들겠습니다. 3. Repository 생성1 github.com 로그인 우상단에서 + → New repository Repository name은 <블로그>로, 공개 설정은 Public으로, Add a license는 MIT로 하고 Create repository 가운데 초록 Code 위에 Settings 밑으로 내려가 GitHub Pages에서 source를 master branch로 변경 우상단에서 + → New repository Repository name은 <블로그 소스>로, 공개 설정은 원하는 대로, license는 MIT로 하고 Create repository 3번의 repository name을 다르게 하면 블로그 주소가 아래와 같습니다.

item.title: Test Post
item.description: Hello World! 안녕하세요. 1. first first content anything print('a') 2. second second content Fusion Drive combines a hard drive with a flash storage (solid-state drive) and presents it as a single logical volume with the space of both drives combined. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet Consectetur adipiscing elit Integer molestie lorem at massa Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet Nulla volutpat aliquam velit Phasellus iaculis neque Purus sodales ultricies Vestibulum laoreet porttitor sem Ac tristique libero volutpat at Faucibus porta lacus fringilla vel Aenean sit amet erat nunc Eget porttitor lorem Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet Consectetur adipiscing elit Integer molestie lorem at massa Facilisis in pretium nisl aliquet Nulla volutpat aliquam velit Faucibus porta lacus fringilla vel Aenean sit amet erat nunc Eget porttitor lorem $$ c = \pm\sqrt{a^2 + b^2} $$

item.title: Search Results
item.description: This file exists solely to respond to /search URL with the related search layout template. No content shown here is rendered, all content is based in the template layouts/page/search.html Setting a very low sitemap priority will tell search engines this is not important content. This implementation uses Fusejs, jquery and mark.js Initial setup Search depends on additional output content type of JSON in config.toml ``` [outputs] home = [“HTML”, “JSON”] ```
